page.title: 09The Stable Yard, Mentmore
page.content: The old Stable yard and coach houses at Mentmore, which used to belong to Mentmore Towers, have taken on a new lease of life in the past 8 years since they were purchased by their present owners. Where there were once derelict and deserted buildings, there is now a charming and beautiful facility visited by about 2,000 people every month, and a source of pride to the residents of the village. Externally the buildings are unchanged, but inside now flourishes a craft shop and tea room, bed and breakfast accomodation, an antique furniture restorer's workshop, and a graphic designer rents out the old granary. The Stable Yard has a staff of 8 women, all local, employed on a casual basis, and are a 'wonderful team' - the owner's words.
